class.name: ChainLoader
class.brief: Static use class for loading .root files into a TChain

method.name: load
method.brief: Loads files in a directory to the TChain
method.doc: Loads .root files containing TTrees into a TChain from the given directory. Make sure that the TChain was created with the correct tree name.

argument.name: chain
argument.doc: an initialized TChain to recieve the files

argument.name: ntdir
argument.doc: path to directory containing .root files or the path to a single .root file

argument.name: maxFiles
argument.doc: maximum number of files to load

method.name: loadList
method.brief: Loads files in a directory to the TChain
method.doc: Loads .root files containing TTrees into a TChain from the given list file. This method allows parallel jobs to work on separate file lists. Make sure that the TChain was created with the correct tree name.

argument.name: chain
argument.doc: an initialized TChain to recieve the files

argument.name: listFile
argument.doc: list of files to add to chain. Should use full pathto file

argument.name: maxFiles
argument.doc: maximum number of files to load

method.name: loadListRange
method.brief: Loads files in a filelist to a TChain
method.doc: Loads .root files containing TTrees into a TChain from the given list file. This method allows parallel jobs to work on separate file lists. Make sure that the TChain was created with the correct tree name.

argument.name: chain
argument.doc: an initialized TChain to recieve the files

argument.name: listFile
argument.doc: list of files to add to chain. Should use full path to file

argument.name: index
argument.doc: job index. files processed is : index * splitBy --> (index+1) * splitBy - 1

method.name: loadRange
method.brief: Loads files in a directory to the TChain
method.doc: Loads .root files containing TTrees into a TChain from the given directory. Make sure that the TChain was created with the correct tree name.

argument.name: chain
argument.doc: an initialized TChain to recieve the files

argument.name: firstFile
argument.doc: the index of the first file to include
